author: senh
title: More Flights Arrive On Time, But Complaints Rise
text: BING NEWS: Nearly one in five U.S. airline flights arrived late in July Although only 78.1 percent of the July flights were on time or within 14 minutes of schedule ... with 6.61 claims per 1,000. The rate of complaints rose in July, with 2.17 complaints per 100,000 passengers, up 0.72 percentage points. 09/10/2015 - 3:24 pm | View Link Hawaiian Airlines regains top spot for on-time flights Alaska Airlines saw 85.6 percent of its flights arrive on time in March and Delta had an 84 percent on-time rating. The U.S. Department of Transportationâ€™s monthly report for March, released Monday, shows consumer complaints against airlines are rising ... 05/10/2015 - 5:00 pm | View Link Fewer flights arrive on time in October American said in a statement that it "will continue to focus on our customers' needs and wants, including improving our on-time performance.'' The number of complaints about mishandled bags dropped in October. There were 2.87 reports of mishandled luggage ... 12/10/2014 - 9:07 am | View Link More Flights Arriving on Time Airlines are doing a better job of having their planes arrive on time, although more than one in five flights ... Virgin America rated best at bag handling, while Envoy was worst by a wide margin. Complaints to the government rose 16%, but the number ... 06/10/2014 - 8:57 am | View Link Airlines Struggle To Stay On Time: One In Four Flights Arrive Late A nationwide computer outage at American Airlines added to the slowdown. The Transportation Department said Thursday that among the 16 airlines that report such information, only 77.3 percent of flights arrived on time ... five days of complaints by ...
